EcmaScript6 Examples - array - entries and keys

EcmaScript 6 has two new features to transform an array in an iterable object. The first one is "entries" that transform an array in an iterable object with key-value pair. The second one is "keys" which transform an array in an iterable object with a list of keys.

Let's see an example: 

                
                    let arr = ['Paul', 'Ringo', 'John'];

                    let entries = arr.entries();
                    console.log(entries);
                    let first = entries.next().value;
                    console.log(first[0]);
                    console.log(first[1]);

                    let keys = arr.keys();
                    console.log(keys);
                    let firstKey = keys.next().value;
                    console.log(firstKey);

In the first example using entries method the object became iterable, and each item has a key and a value. In second example using keys method was created an iterable object which has a list of keys.
